main road Pondy - Marakkanam - Mahabalipuram; beyond Marakkanam, at Venangapattu, road to the left towards Chunampet; scrub jungle (abandoned Eucalyptus plantation) to the North of the road; These plants play an important role in the ayurvedic medicine of the island (Sri Lanka). A water extract from the stems and roots has been used to cure almost everything from depression to dysentery. The root is considered a febrifuge; smoking the leaves is said to be a remedy for asthma. One man in Galle said that a decoction of the mashed plant and sesame oil "cools the brain". This apparently means that there is a calming effect. (Rev. Handb. Fl. Ceylon, I, 310)

column19: the site of the Kudankulam Atomic Power Project is located along the coast of the Gulf of Mannar, 25 km north-east of Kanniyakumari, and has a surface area of about 1000 ha.  One side of the area largely consists of limestone deposits, the other half has laterite soil with a good layer of topsoil.  It is a drought prone area with a mean annual rainfall of about 650 mm, but the rain is erratic.  Water is scarce and all the wells in and around the site yield saline water

main road Pondy - Tindivanam; just before Tindivanam secondary road to the right towards Marakkanam; after 7 Km road to the left towards Kattalai; most of the Reserve Forest is under Eucalyptus (with occasional patches of scrub jungle); the patches of scrub jungle have become larger and the vegetation has improved since our survey in 1999.
